publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2783# Marilyn Livingstone: National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuseâ€”That the Parliament welcomes the work of the Cross-Party Group on Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse in co-ordinating and developing an outline national strategy for children and adults who have experienced sexual abuse during childhood and, in light of recommendations made by the independent inquiry commissioned by Fife Council following the conviction of David Logan Murphy, believes that the Scottish Executive should actively develop a national strategy, based on the work of the Cross-Party Group on Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse, that considers the wider social, health, mental and legal implications of sexual abuse and its impact on survivors and society as a whole. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-2783# National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 26 February 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Elaine Thomson*, David Mundell*, Mr John McAllion*, Karen Gillon*, Rhoda Grant*, Fiona McLeod*, Trish Godman*, Kate Maclean*, Jackie Baillie*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Tavish Scott*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Alex Neil*, Mr Keith Harding*, Margaret Jamieson*
S1M-2783# National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 26 February 2002) Karen Whitefield*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Maureen Macmillan*, Cathie Craigie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*

S1M-2783# Marilyn Livingstone: National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse-That the Parliament welcomes the work of the Cross-Party Group on Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse in co-ordinating and developing an outline national strategy for children and adults who have experienced sexual abuse during childhood and, in light of recommendations made by the independent inquiry commissioned by Fife Council following the conviction of David Logan Murphy, believes that the Scottish Executive should actively develop a national strategy, based on the work of the Cross-Party Group on Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse, that considers the wider social, health, mental and legal implications of sexual abuse and its impact on survivors and society as a whole. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Stewart Stevenson, Elaine Thomson, David Mundell, Mr John McAllion, Karen Gillon, Rhoda Grant, Fiona McLeod, Trish Godman, Kate Maclean, Jackie Baillie, Brian Fitzpatrick, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Tavish Scott, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Alex Neil, Mr Keith Harding, Margaret Jamieson, Karen Whitefield, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Maureen Macmillan, Cathie Craigie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh
S1M-2783# National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 26 February 2002) Robin Harper*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2783# National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 26 February 2002) Sarah Boyack*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2783# National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 26 February 2002) Johann Lamont*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2783# National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 26 February 2002) Elaine Smith*
S1M-2783# National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 26 February 2002) Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Bill Butler*
S1M-2783# National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 26 February 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-2783# National Strategy for Survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 26 February 2002) Mr Adam Ingram*
